channel.title: BBC News - Wales

item.title: Covid: Tooth loss fears over dentist check-up delays
item.description: The British Dental Association wants rules for dentists eased in Wales.

item.title: Shotton: Man charged with murder of Jade Ward , 27
item.description: Jade Ward was found dead at a property in Shotton, Flintshire, at about 09:30 BST on Thursday.

item.title: Stormzy, Skepta and Aitch: Making beats for rap stars at 19
item.description: Chris Rich has made thousands from creating beats in the style of hip hop's elite.

item.title: Snowdon: Amputee Paul Ellis' 13-hour crawl to reach summit
item.description: Paul Ellis, who had both his legs amputated in 2008, says the support of passers-by kept him going.

item.title: Risca HGV driver wins £275k McLaren supercar in raffle
item.description: A grandfather-of-three wins a McLaren 720S Spider after buying 40 tickets in a charity raffle.

item.title: Online loans: 'I went from loaning £150 to owing £6,000 in months'
item.description: Within months of his first payday loan, Tom owed thousands of pounds to 10 lenders.

item.title: Cardiff stabbing: Man, 18, seriously hurt and three arrested
item.description: Two men and a woman are arrested on suspicion of grievous bodily harm and are in police custody.

item.title: Bank holiday: Travel warning as sunshine forecast in Wales
item.description: Drivers warned travel times could double as people head to enjoy the bank holiday weekend weather.

item.title: Flintshire: Milk vending machine business may be shut down
item.description: People were fined for travelling 20 miles to get milk from the roadside machines during lockdown.

item.title: Wrexham man's anguish over family stuck in Afghanistan
item.description: He fled the country in 2002 after the fall of the Taliban but the militants are back in control.

item.title: Covid outbreak in two north Wales hospitals
item.description: The hospitals have 34 patients with Covid with 14 being linked to the outbreak.

item.title: Payday lenders: 'They are robbing the vulnerable'
item.description: Within months of his first £150 payday loan, Tom owed £6,000 to 10 lenders.

item.title: Snowdon: Amputee crawls up mountain to raise funds for children
item.description: It will be the first time Paul Ellis has made his way up a mountain after losing his legs in 2008.

item.title: North Wales tourism has strained communities, authority says
item.description: Snowdonia National Park Authority said numbers visiting brought benefits and challenges.

item.title: Scrapping theory tests could cut HGV driver shortage, says instructor
item.description: One lorry driving instructor said it can take up to 16 months to train up new drivers.

item.title: Covid: Stay outside for the bank holiday, minister urges
item.description: Health Minister Eluned Morgan said, amid rising case rates, people need to take precautions

item.title: Wales donates unneeded PPE to help Covid-hit Namibia
item.description: Masks, gowns and sanitiser are being sent to help the country as it struggles with a third wave.

item.title: Preston North End 3-1 Swansea City: Lilywhites ease to comeback win over ragged Swans
item.description: Preston North End claim a second successive Championship win as they ease past a ragged Swansea City.

item.title: Cardiff City 1-2 Bristol City: Weimann at the double for Bristol City
item.description: Cardiff City are beaten for the first time in the Championship this season thanks to an Andreas Weimann double for Bristol City.

item.title: Russell Martin: Swansea City boss braced for transfer market 'chaos'
item.description: Russell Martin is braced for "chaos" in the final stages of the summer transfer window as he bids to strengthen his Swansea City squad.

item.title: Salford City 3-0 Newport County: Three first-half goals seal Salford victory
item.description: Salford City secured their first league win of the season with a 3-0 victory over Newport County in League Two.

item.title: Eastleigh 0-2 Wrexham: Jake Hyde brace earns Wrexham win
item.description: Jake Hyde's first-half brace earns big-spending Wrexham their first win of the National League season at Eastleigh.

item.title: Twristiaeth: Y canolbarth yn 'brysurach nag erioed'
item.description: Galw am fuddsoddi er mwyn i'r canolbarth allu manteisio yn economaidd am flynyddoedd i ddod.

item.title: Cyhuddo dyn o lofruddio menyw 27 oed yn Shotton
item.description: Dyn wedi cael ei gyhuddo o lofruddiaeth yn dilyn marwolaeth Jade Ward yn Shotton, Sir y Fflint.

item.title: 'Es i o fenthyg £150 ar-lein i fod mewn £6,000 o ddyled'
item.description: Dyn o Sir Ddinbych yn rhybuddio yn erbyn defnyddio benthycwyr diwrnod cyflog yn dilyn ei brofiad ef.

item.title: Y Bencampwriaeth: Preston North End 3-1 Abertawe
item.description: Dechrau siomedig yr Elyrch i'r tymor yn parhau wrth iddyn nhw gael eu trechu gan Preston North End.
